Class Service

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service

  • public class Service
extends java.lang.Object
    A Service consists of a set of triggers and actions that are connected with Boolean algebraic statements. This algebraic relationship is represented by a set of LogicBlock objects that each represent a piece of the logic of a Service. Each Service also has a name and serviceID.

    A Service does not run in its own Thread because LogicBlock objects used in one Service can be used in others as well. Therefore another class handles the updating of appropriate LogicBlock objects as triggers occur in the system. This class handles the creation, editing, and removal of a Service from the system.

    Author:
    Shawn Koop

    • Field Detail

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        The name of the Service.

      • representation

        private java.lang.String representation
        A String representation of the logic of the Service that follows the following instructions.

        Triggers and Actions

        Triggers and actions are both represented by a name associated with the peripheral whose trigger or action is being represented, followed by a ':::', followed by the name of the trigger or action itself, followed by zero or more arguments, all separated by a ':::'. For example, a trigger named "trig" occuring on peripheral "ed" is represented as "ed:::trig". Or, a trigger named "tempGreaterThan" occurring on peripheral "thermometer" with one argument, the threshold temperature, is represented as "thermometer:::tempGreaterThan:::21".

        Implications

        All services follow the format "A::->B" where B is an action and A is a combination of various triggers. B follows the format described under the Triggers and Actions section. For example, an action named "doStuff" with no arguments to be done on peripheral "c" is represented as "c:::doStuff".

        Combinations of Triggers

        The combination of triggers that precedes the implication sign in the String representation of the service can make use of none, one, or both of the logical operators OR and AND. The logical operator OR is represented as a '+' and the logical operator AND is represented as a '&'. Each layer of operations is to be enclosed in parentheses (preceded by '::'), including the case with no operations (a trigger). For example, the combination of the triggers "1:::a" and "2:::b" using the OR operator is denoted as "::(::(1:::a::)+::(2:::b::)::)". It is important that NO SPACES are used in the representation, except in the actual names of peripherals, triggers, and arguments. For another example, consider "::(::(::(1:::a::)+::(2:::b::)::)&::(3:::c::)::)", taking the AND of the result of the previous example and the trigger "3:::c". Both the AND and OR operations support more than two terms. For example, ::(::(1:::a::)+::(2:::b::)+::(3:::c::)::) is a valid combination. Lastly, for clarity, a service whose combination consists of only one trigger, say "1:::a", has a trigger combination "::(1:::a::)".

        Services of Multiple Parts

        A service may be comprised of multiple parts. Each part follows the "A::->B" format mentioned earlier and is separated from other parts by a '::,'. For example, "::(1:::a::)::->4:::doStuff::,::(::(1:::a::)&::(2:::b::)::)::->3:::doOtherStuff" is a valid service representation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Service

        public Service(java.lang.String name,
       int serviceID,
       java.lang.String serviceRepresentation,
       java.util.ArrayList<TriggerLogicBlock> triggers,
       java.util.ArrayList<Peripheral> peripherals)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new Service object and adds it to the system of LogicBlock objects.
        Parameters:
        name - A String containing the name of the new Service
        serviceID - An int containing the ID number of the new Service
        serviceRepresentation - A String representation of the logic of the new Service
        triggers - An ArrayList of TriggerLogicBlock objects that gives access to all LogicBlock objects in the entire system.
        peripherals - An ArrayList of all Peripheral objects in the system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown when there is an error creating the service.

      • deleteFromSystem

        public void deleteFromSystem(java.util.ArrayList<TriggerLogicBlock> triggers)
        Removes this Service from the system which is given as an ArrayList of TriggerLogicBlock objects.
        Parameters:
        triggers - An ArrayList of TriggerLogicBlock objects representing the system to delete this Service from

      • removeBlocks

        private static void removeBlocks(java.util.ArrayList<TriggerLogicBlock> triggers,
                java.util.ArrayList<LogicBlock> blocksToDelete)
        Removes a specified list of logic blocks from a Service by calling the removeFromService method in the LogicBlock class.

        If a TriggerLogicBlock object is included in blocksToDelete and was only a part of one Service, it is removed from the list of all TriggerLogicBlock objects in the system.

        Parameters:
        triggers - An ArrayList containing all of the TriggerLogicBlock objects in the system
        blocksToDelete - An ArrayList containing all of the LogicBlock objects to be removed from a Service

      • editService

        public boolean editService(java.lang.String editedServiceRepresentation,
                  java.util.ArrayList<TriggerLogicBlock> triggers,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Peripheral> peripherals)
        If the provided editedServiceRepresentation is not the same as the String representation of the logic of this Service, LogicBlock objects are added to or removed from this Service as necessary such that when this method completes this Service will be representable by editedServiceString. Upon completion of this method, representation and editedServiceRepresentation are the same.
        Parameters:
        editedServiceRepresentation - The new String representation of the logic of this Service.
        triggers - An ArrayList containing all of the TriggerLogicBlock objects in the system
        peripherals - An ArrayList of all Peripheral objects in the system.
        Returns:
        A boolean stating whether or not the service was successfully edited.

      • addServiceToSystem

        private static java.util.ArrayList<LogicBlock> addServiceToSystem(java.lang.String representation,
                                                 java.util.ArrayList<TriggerLogicBlock> triggerBlocks,
                                                 java.util.ArrayList<Peripheral> peripherals)
                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method adds a service that follows a given representation to the system represented by a given ArrayList of TriggerLogicBlock objects. If a required LogicBlock is not already in the system, it is created and added to the system.

        An ArrayList of all LogicBlock objects required to fulfill the representation is returned.

        The numServices values of each LogicBlock are updated as appropriate.

        Parameters:
        representation - A String representation of the logic of the service to be added to the system.
        triggerBlocks - An ArrayList of TriggerLogicBlock objects that gives access to all LogicBlock objects in the entire system.
        peripherals - An ArrayList of all Peripheral objects in the system.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList containing all of the LogicBlock objects that are part of the service that was added to the system, null if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown when there is an error adding the service to the system.

      • addTriggerCombinationToSystem

        private static LogicBlock addTriggerCombinationToSystem(java.lang.String triggerCombinations,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<TriggerLogicBlock> triggerBlocks,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<Peripheral> peripherals,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<LogicBlock> serviceBlocks)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This method adds LogicBlock objects that follow the interpretation of a set of triggerCombinations to the system represented by a given ArrayList of TriggerLogicBlock objects.

        If a required LogicBlock is not already in the system, it is created and added to the system.

        The LogicBlock whose output is logically equivalent to the given triggerCombinations is returned.

        The numServices values of each LogicBlock are updated as appropriate.

        An ArrayList of LogicBlock objects already in the Service that the triggerCombinations are a part of is updated as new LogicBlock objects are found or created.

        Parameters:
        triggerCombinations - A String containing logical combinations of triggers
        triggerBlocks - An ArrayList of TriggerLogicBlock objects that gives access to all LogicBlock objects in the entire system
        peripherals - An ArrayList of all Peripheral objects in the system
        serviceBlocks - An ArrayList of LogicBlock objects already in the Service that the triggerCombinations are a part of
        Returns:
        The LogicBlock whose output is logically equivalent to the given triggerCombinations, null if a problem occurred
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown when there is an error adding the trigger combination to the system.
